title: Slow Looking: Found Art, Appropriation, and Pop (October 7)
title_display: Slow Looking: Found Art, Appropriation, and Pop
hero_caption: Andy Warhol. Liz #3 [Early Colored Liz], 1963. Gift of Edlis Neeson Collection. © 2018 The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc. / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York.
short_description: What happens when instead of making their artwork, an artist finds it? Or even takes it?
list_description: What happens when instead of making their artwork, an artist finds it? Or even takes it?
description:
What happens when instead of making their artwork, an artist finds it? Or even takes it? This conversation explores the trajectory of found art and appropriation, from Marcel Duchamp to Andy Warhol to today. 

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
